thread.title: South Tyneside EU Referendum results: Did your area vote Leave or Remain?
thread.title_full: South Tyneside EU Referendum results: Did your area vote Leave or Remain?

author: Keiran Southern
title: South Tyneside EU Referendum results: Did your area vote Leave or Remain?
text:
Voters in the borough sent out a resounding message with a clear majority for those wishing to leave. 
The Leave campaign won by 49,065 votes against 30,014 for Remain, with a turnout of 79,079 (68.24%). 
South Tyneside joined North Tyneside, Durham, Gateshead, Sunderland and Northumberland in voting for Brexit, while Newcastle voted in favour of Remain. 
Leader of South Tyneside Council, Iain Malcolm, said he was “disappointed” with the result but accepted the decision. 
He added: “The result of South Tyneside is very much in line with the rest of the North East. 
“I am clearly disappointed with the result but it is a democratic decision of the people and it is now up to the politicians to get on with the process. 
“There are huge implications for our political and economic life. It will have implications for the North East and we will have to see what happens now in terms of Government. 
“Will David Cameron still be Prime Minister and will George Osborne still be Chancellor? The Government will now be required to put its energy into leaving the EU. 
“In political and economic terms this turns the world upside down but it is the decision of the British people and I respect that. 
“It is a momentous decision, the biggest this country has made in my lifetime.” 
In the biggest political move in living memory, the British public narrowly voted for Brexit following a gruelling 10-week campaign. 
Results after 0 of 382 areas declared Waiting for the first results Leave: 1,197 votes (50%) As it stands Britain is set to Remain in the EU
